title: Tuning Reference
description:
Tuning reference is a format component that tells what pitch class should be used on the keyboard for the base pitch and what tuning deviation should that have with respect to standard tuning (12-EDO).
As any format component it can be defined as an object with a "type" property that identifies the tuning reference to be used. Check the documentation for that property for details about what tuning reference types are supported.

type.title: Tuning Reference Type
type.description:
Name that serves as a unique identifier for the Tuning Reference Type. The following values are allowed:
- "standard": Tuning reference relative standard tuning (12-EDO).
- "concertPitch": Tuning reference relative to concert pitch.

basePitchClass.title: Base Pitch Class
basePitchClass.description: The integer number (0-11) that identifies the pitch class on the keyboard to be used for the base pitch. 0 is C, 1 is C♯/D♭, ..., 11 is B.

baseDeviation.title: Base Deviation
baseDeviation.description: Deviation in cents of the base pitch with respect to the standard (12-EDO) pitch class tuning.

allOf.title: Concert Pitch to Base Pitch Interval
allOf.description: Interval between the concert pitch (reference frequency) and composition's base pitch.

baseMidiNote.title: Base MIDI Note Number
baseMidiNote.description: MIDI note number of the composition's base pitch, relative to which scales are tuned.

concertPitchFrequency.title: Concert Pitch Frequency (Hz)
concertPitchFrequency.description: Reference frequency in Hz, typically known as concert pitch, and set to 440 Hz.
